alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Nemaha; Otoe (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 14 at 8:52PM CDT until April 14 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: The National Weather Service in Omaha has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Johnson County in southeastern Nebraska... Northwestern Nemaha County in southeastern Nebraska... Central Otoe County in southeastern Nebraska... * Until 945 PM CDT. * At 850 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles west of Unadilla to 4 miles northwest of Cook to 4 miles southwest of Tecumseh, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. These storms have a history of producing wind damage to power lines and road signs. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Unadilla around 855 PM CDT. Syracuse around 905 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Dunbar, Brock, Talmage and Lorton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
